entries.title: Lenovo's Yogi Book 9i makes a case for dual-screen laptops, and it doesn't suck
entries.description: Housing two OLED screens, the 9i postures itself a versatile laptop for work and creativity.

entries.title: Dell wants to cut out Chinese-made chips
entries.description: Dell is reportedly preparing to move manufacturing and assembly away from China, and others could be following.

entries.title: Your next Android phone might text via satellite, thanks to Qualcomm
entries.description: We took a long ride into the desert at CES 2023 to see a live demo of Qualcomm's new Snapdragon Satellite communications platform.

entries.title: Asus reveals world-first glasses-free 3D OLED laptop
entries.description: New ASUS laptop announcements at CES 2023 look to wow content creators.

entries.title: LGs newest vacuum cleaner is full steam (mop) ahead
entries.description: The LG CordZero™ A9 Kompressor with Steam Power Mop is the company’s first cordless stick vacuum cleaner to offer steam mopping functionality.

entries.title: Audio-Technica re-released its iconic Sound Burger turntable at CES 2023 and I want one
entries.description: Audio-Technica re-released its four-decades-old Sound Burger to mark its 60th year of trading back in November – and the firm is now offering it again owing to unprecedented demand.

entries.title: LastPass is being sued following major cyberattack
entries.description: A disgruntled LastPass customer has sued LastPass for its poor response to August 2022 cyberattack.

entries.title: HTC’s Vive XR Elite is already the most exciting VR headset of 2023
entries.description: The HTC Vive XR Elite may not blow Meta out of the water in terms of price or specs, but its modular design has won me over.

entries.title: Rian Johnson's new Peacock show will fill the Knives Out-shaped hole in your life
entries.description: Poker Face, which releases exclusively on Peacock later in January, is Rian Johnson's first foray into the world of television.

entries.title: Some of Slack's private GitHub code was stolen following a data breach
entries.description: No downloaded repositories contained customer data, or means to access customer data, Slack claims.

entries.title: World War Z is adding waves of 1,000 zombies, but I can't even handle one
entries.description: World War Z's new update is adding 1,000 zombie waves, but will it be too much for uncoordinated teams to handle?

entries.title: Why Dell Technologies is the technology partner your small business needs this year
entries.description: Start 2023 off with some great new additions from Dell.

entries.title: Another vital Windows tool is being abused to sideload malware
entries.description: Researchers find another Windows tool being abused to sideload malware.

entries.title: Motorola's new business-only ThinkPhone has features every Moto user deserves
entries.description: Lenovo has tasked Motorola with making the business-first ThinkPhone, and it has features everyone would want.

entries.title: This new Xbox controller sets itself apart with a unique feature
entries.description: The Asus ROG Raikiri Pro Xbox controller has a fun, if a bit gimmicky, OLED screen.

entries.title: Windows 11 bug is randomly freezing PCs with AMD CPUs
entries.description: This isn’t the first time Windows 11 has run into trouble with Ryzen processors, either.

entries.title: Samsung TVs are getting an exciting upgrade thanks to Philips Hue smart lights
entries.description: Modern Samsung QLED TVs are getting an app that will let them sync with Philips Hue lights for an immersive Ambilight experience.

entries.title: CircleCI tells users to move their secrets following security alert
entries.description: The company is keeping silent on the details, but seems to have suffered a breach over the holidays.

entries.title: Meta fined €390M over GDPR breaches for its ad and data handling practices
entries.description: Meta has three months to make its data collection practices legal in Europe, or it may have to consider leaving the European Union.

entries.title: Ring Car Cam could catch someone trying to hijack your car and let you yell at them, too
entries.description: Ring unveils its new dual-camera Car Cam to keep watch over the inside and outside of your car

entries.title: Fire Emblem Engage's difficulty cracked my brain open like an egg
entries.description: Fire Emblem Engage returns to the roots of the series, offering unforgiving tactical combat that kept me up at night.

entries.title: The US’s largest education department just blocked ChatGPT
entries.description: ChatGPT is at the center of a row about plagiarism in American high schools, but educators may be missing the point.

entries.title: Gran Turismo 7 is getting PSVR 2 support and that makes me very nervous
entries.description: During it's CES presentation, Sony revealed simulation racer Gran Turismo 7 is getting PSVR 2 support.

entries.title: Focal Vestia are the most gorgeous speakers I've seen at CES 2023
entries.description: Focal's Vestia range takes its name from the goddeses of hearth and home (Vesta and Hestia), and it shows.

entries.title: This stand mixer is causing a stir at CES – and it's a smart option for bakers
entries.description: The GE Profile Smart Mixer with Auto Sense is claimed to be the smartest Mixer in the USA, and it's a winner in more ways than one.

entries.title: Microsoft Windows boss says AI will "reinvent how you do everything"
entries.description: AMD’s partnership with Microsoft will see Windows operating systems benefit from dedicated AI engines.

entries.title: Madden 23 players mourn lost teams as bug breaks 60% of affected saves
entries.description: A Madden 23 server error causes players to lose their saves in the title’s popular Franchise Mode.

entries.title: Intel Arc GPU that could finally worry AMD and Nvidia may be coming – but not until 2024
entries.description: A leak shows two Battlemage GPUs are inbound, including a heavyweight model for the enthusiast PC segment.

entries.title: Another huge Twitter user database has been leaked online
entries.description: More than 200 million Twitter data entries are on sale for a tempting price of just $2.

entries.title: The Google Pixel 7a could render the Pixel 7 redundant
entries.description: A leaked hands-on Google Pixel 7a video suggests the upcoming phone might be very similar to the Pixel 7.

entries.title: PS5's Project Leonardo could continue Sony's excellent accessibility track record
entries.description: Sony unveiled Project Leonardo at CES 2023, a new accessibility controller for PS5.

entries.title: Major security flaws found in Mercedes, Ferrari and other top luxury cars
entries.description: Flaws allowed threat actors to steal private data and start cars, but should be fixed now.

entries.title: Where to buy the Nvidia RTX 4070 Ti: stock goes live today!
entries.description: Here's how to get your hands on Nvidia's new RTX 4070 Ti, which starts at $799.

entries.title: Amazon reveals huge job layoffs to help cut costs
entries.description: Amazon is the latest tech giant making major cutbacks, with 18,000 jobs gone since November 2021.

entries.title: Witchfire’s world isn’t closed or open; the steampunk shooter is right in the middle
entries.description: The devs behind Wicthfire weren't happy with their near-finished game so they decided to make a big change.

entries.title: Sony and Honda's Afeela self-driving car is not quite giving us the feels
entries.description: The electronics giant and car company have unveiled a prototype EV for their new and oddly-named Afeela brand at CES.

entries.title: AMD CES 2023 keynote liveblog: Dr. Lisa Su kicks off the biggest tech event of the year
entries.description: We're live on the ground in Las Vegas as AMD CEO Dr. Lisa Su gives the opening keynote address for CES 2023.
